snippet: Ivory Coast’s military tribunal has started the first trial stemming from last year’s postelection violence, a case that involves the March 2011 killing of a colonel.
abstract: Ivory Coast's military tribunal begins first trial stemming from 2011 postelection violence following former Pres Laurent Gbagbo's loss to Alassane Ouattara; Bruno Dogbo Ble, head of Gbagbo’s Republican Guard, has been charged with kidnapping, murder and genocide.
lead_paragraph: Ivory Coast’s military tribunal has started the first trial stemming from last year’s postelection violence, a case that involves the March 2011 killing of a colonel.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
